data.text: Nevertheless thy saints had a very great light,
But for that they did not hurt them now, of whom they had been wronged before, they thanked them,
Instead whereof thou gavest them a burning pillar of fire,
For they were worthy to be deprived of light, and imprisoned in darkness,
And when they had determined to slay the babes of the saints,
Of that night were our fathers certified afore,
So of thy people was accepted both the salvation of the righteous,
For wherewith thou didst punish our adversaries,
For the righteous children of good men did sacrifice secretly,
But on the other side there sounded an ill according cry of the enemies,
The master and the servant were punished after one manner;
So they all together had innumerable dead with one kind of death;
For whereas they would not believe anything by reason of the enchantments;
For while all things were in quiet silence,
Thine Almighty word leaped from heaven out of thy royal throne,
And brought thine unfeigned commandment as a sharp sword,
Then suddenly visions of horrible dreams troubled them sore,
And one thrown here, and another there, half dead,
For the dreams that troubled them did foreshow this,
Yea, the tasting of death touched the righteous also,
For then the blameless man made haste, and stood forth to defend them;
So he overcame the destroyer, not with might of body,
For when the dead were now fallen down by heaps one upon another,
For in the long garment was the whole world,
Unto these the destroyer gave place, and they were afraid of them:
